We have a paper wasp nest above our heads on our back porch. Right above my head when I paint every day. It's a few years old and very active, hundreds of the ladies. The size of a football this year. They don't bother us and we sure don't bother them. Recently most of them left to start their own families. We're interested in seeing how big it gets over the years.
Also, we have a big food garden that has absolutely no pests. The wasps eat everything. When our picky cat won't eat her wet food we give it to the wasps.
We show them respect and they help us grow food. Good deal.
Edit: We tell visitors in case they're allergic. We've never been stung but it's best to be careful.
